Sentencas: This paper presents a new computational framework for modeling chemically reacting flow in anode-supported solid-oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Depending on materials and operating conditions, SOFC anodes afford a possibility for internal reforming or catalytic partial oxidation of hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An important new element of the model is the capability to represent elementary heterogeneous chemical kinetics in the form of multistep reaction mechanisms.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Porous-media transport in the electrodes is represented with a dusty-gas model.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Charge-transfer chemistry is represented in a modified Butler-Volmer setting that is derived from elementary reactions, but assuming a single rate-limiting step.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model is discussed in terms of systems with defined flow channels and planar membrane-electrode assemblies.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the underlying theory is independent of the particular geometry.
Titulo: Modeling elementary heterogeneous chemistry and electrochemistry in solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Examples are given to illustrate the model.
